action.action-desc: Mr. Ratcliffe introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to transfer certain National Forest System land in the State of Texas.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Lake Fannin Conveyance Act.

paragraph.text: The term County means the County of Fannin, Texas.
The term map means the map entitled Lake Fannin Conveyance and dated November 21, 2013.
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service.

subsection.text: Subject to the provisions of this Act, if the County submits a written request for conveyance not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary shall convey to the County all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to approximately 2,025 acres of National Forest System land, as generally depicted on the map.

paragraph.text: The map shall be kept on file and available for public inspection in the appropriate office of the Forest Service.
The Secretary may correct minor errors in the map.

subsection.text: The conveyance under subsection (a) shall be—

paragraph.text: subject to any other terms and conditions as the Secretary considers appropriate to protect the interests of the United States.

subsection.text: As a condition for the conveyance under subsection (a), the County shall pay for all costs associated with the conveyance, including—

paragraph.text: the survey to Federal standards required by subsection (e); and
any environmental analysis and resource surveys determined necessary by Federal law.
The actual acreage and legal description of the National Forest System land to be conveyed under subsection (a) shall be determined by a survey satisfactory to the Secretary.
The Secretary may perform and approve any cadastral surveys required to be conducted for purposes of the conveyance referred to in paragraph (1).
